Key Match Events: Iceland staged a second half comeback to earn a 2-2 draw at home to Wales
Logi Tomasson curled a shot into the far bottom corner from the edge of the box to pull one back for Iceland in the 69th minute
Danny Ward's deflection off his near post sent the ball into his own net for the deserved equaliser in the 72nd minute
Post-Match Reflections: Wales, still unbeaten under Craig Bellamy after three games, are second in the group on five points, two behind leaders Turkey
Iceland are third with four points
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Laugardalsv√∂llur in Reykjavik, Iceland, with an attendance of 6,141
The game was refereed by Antoni Bandic
